item.title: Word of the Day: abstruse
item.description: This word has appeared in 15 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: You Can’t Drone Strike a Global Drug Chain
item.description: Turning Latin America into a theater of war will not weaken transnational crime; it will entrench it.
item.dc:creator: Matias Spektor and Oto Montagner

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Ricardo Tomás; source image by aleksandarvelasevic via Getty Images

item.title: A New World Is Taking Shape, No Matter What Trump Does
item.description: America’s days of unipolar supremacy are past.
item.dc:creator: Sarang Shidore

item.title: ‘Tell Me Lies,’ Plus 8 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The college-set drama returns and a “Game of Thrones” prequel premieres.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: Jackson White and Grace Van Patten in “Tell Me Lies.”

item.title: Golden Globe Awards 2026: Best Looks From Teyana Taylor, Jennifer Lawrence and More
item.description: Sheer gowns, slouchy tuxedos, chunky-soled boots and more.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

media:content.media:description: Teyana Taylor’s gown had cutouts that showed off some of her chest (and some of her backside).

item.title: Death Toll Surges in Iran Protests
item.description: Crowds gathered at a morgue outside Tehran as the death toll from protests in Iran surged. President Trump hinted on Sunday that the United States may intercede if peaceful protesters are killed.
item.dc:creator: Jiawei Wang, Malachy Browne and Sanjana Varghese

media:content.media:credit: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Masoud Pezeshkian of Iran at a news conference in Tehran in 2024.

item.title: Nikki Glaser Ended the Golden Globes by Honoring Rob Reiner
item.description: In a “Spinal Tap” baseball cap, Glaser concluded the ceremony by saying, “This one went to 11.”
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens

media:content.media:description: Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, shown in 2013, were killed last month.

item.title: No Corrections: Jan. 12, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Jan. 12, 2026.

item.title: Quote of the Day: This League Calls for 2 Things: Lots of Flab and a Funny Bone
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, January 12, 2026.

item.title: ‘One Battle After Another’ Wins Golden Globe for Best Comedy
item.description: The victory cements the film’s front-runner status heading into the Oscars.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman

media:content.media:credit: Warner Bros. Pictures, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Leonardo DiCaprio as the former radical Bob in “One Battle After Another.”

item.title: U-Haul Truck Drives Into Crowd of Iran Protesters in Los Angeles
item.description: The city is home to a large Iranian American community, and protests against the Iranian government drew thousands on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales and Shawn Hubler

media:content.media:description: A man in a U-Haul truck drove into a group of people in Los Angeles protesting against Iran’s government on Sunday.

item.title: Mayor Mamdani Is Moving On Up to Gracie Mansion
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani and his wife, Rama Duwaji, have begun moving their belongings from their Queens apartment to the official mayor’s residence in Manhattan.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Shapiro and William K. Rashbaum

media:content.media:description: Gracie Mansion, the New York City mayor’s official residence, features security including a fence dotted with cameras.

item.title: Nikki Glaser Doesn’t Spare CBS News in 2026 Golden Globes Monologue
item.description: For her second consecutive year as host, Glaser delivered a killer set of rapid-fire, very short jokes.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman

media:content.media:credit: Kevork Djansezian/CBS Broadcasting, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Nikki Glaser returned for a second year as host of the Globes.

item.title: Avalanche in Washington State Kills 2
item.description: The men were among a group of four skiing in the backcountry near Longs Pass, east of Seattle in the Cascade Mountains. The area received heavy snowfall last week.
item.dc:creator: Livia Albeck-Ripka

item.title: Timothée Chalamet Wins Best Actor at the 2026 Golden Globes, Musical or Comedy
item.description: The actor won for his role in “Marty Supreme.” After five Golden Globe nominations, this is Chalamet’s first win.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 Photos: Stars of ‘Hamnet,’ ‘One Battle After Another’ and More
item.description: Our photographer is capturing behind-the-scenes moments with stars at Sunday night’s awards show.
item.dc:creator: Sinna Nasseri

media:content.media:credit: Sinna Nasseri for The New York Times

item.title: Daniel Walker Howe, Historian of Antebellum America, Dies at 88
item.description: He saw the origins of modern America in the years between 1815 and 1848, when revolutions in technology and media transformed a nation of isolated farms.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

item.title: Allegiant to Buy Sun Country Airlines in $1.5 Billion Deal
item.description: The combination of the two small, budget airlines comes as low-cost carriers have struggled with high costs and competition.
item.dc:creator: Niraj Chokshi

media:content.media:description: Both Allegiant and Sun Country focus on providing cheap flights to people traveling for fun or to visit friends and family.

item.title: Golden Globes Winners 2026: Full List Including ’One Battle After Another,’ ‘Sinners’ and ‘Adolescence’
item.description: The winning films, TV shows, actors and production teams at the 2026 Golden Globe Awards.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:credit: Rich Polk/Penske Media, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Chloé Zhao, center, accepting the award for best motion picture drama: “Hamnet.”

item.title: Demonstrators Around the World Show Solidarity for Iran Protests
item.description: For several nights in a row, antigovernment protests have rocked Iran, as a government crackdown intensifies. This weekend, protesters around the world showed their solidarity for the people of Iran and demanded world leaders take action.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

item.title: Federal Prosecutors Open Investigation Into Fed Chair Powell
item.description: The investigation, which is said to center on renovations of the Federal Reserve’s headquarters in Washington, signals an escalation in the long-running clash between President Trump and the chair.
item.dc:creator: Glenn Thrush and Colby Smith

media:content.media:description: President Trump, left, and the Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, right, touring the renovation site at the central bank’s headquarters in Washington in July.

item.title: La tecnología que invadirá nuestras vidas en 2026
item.description: Desde computadoras que hablan hasta vehículos que se manejan solos, hay una gran variedad de tendencias que habrá que seguir en 2026.
item.dc:creator: Brian X. Chen

item.title: Two Hours, Scores of Questions, 23,000 Words: Our Interview With President Trump
item.description: Four New York Times reporters pressed Mr. Trump about a range of topics in a nearly two-hour interview. Here is a transcript of their conversation.

media:content.media:description: The Times journalists were with President Trump for roughly four hours, which included an off-the-record call with the president of Colombia and a walk-through of the official residence and parts of the West Wing with Mr. Trump.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Jan. 12, 2026
item.description: Carolyn Davies Lynch and Christina Iverson collaborate on a poetic puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Crystal Arroyo

media:content.media:description: Fear not — the Wordplay columnists have your back.

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 Red Carpet: Nikki Glaser, Teyana Taylor, Jean Smart, Timothée Chalamet and More
item.description: Selena Gomez, Timothée Chalamet and the stars of “Heated Rivalry” were among the celebrities who arrived at the annual ceremony in high style.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

media:content.media:description: Selena Gomez, a nominee, arrived in a Chanel gown.

item.title: Jean Smart, Mark Ruffalo and Natasha Lyonne Wear Anti-ICE Pins at 2026 Golden Globes
item.description: Mark Ruffalo, Wanda Sykes, Natasha Lyonne and Jean Smart were among the celebrities taking part in the campaign.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik

media:content.media:description: Mark Ruffalo wearing a “Be Good” pin on the red carpet.

item.title: Deposed Shah’s Son Hopes Trump Will Put Iran Regime ‘Down for Good’
item.description: Reza Pahlavi, once the crown prince of Iran, says protesters there have been emboldened by President Trump suggesting that he could take military action.
item.dc:creator: Erika Solomon
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Demonstrators in Austria displayed images of Reza Pahlavi during a rally on Sunday in support of nationwide protests in Iran.

item.title: Trump Says Civil Rights Led to White People Being ‘Very Badly Treated’
item.description: President Trump’s comments were a blunt distillation of his administration’s racial politics, which rest on the belief that white people have become the real victims of discrimination in America.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump has equated diversity with incompetence and inferiority, and cast himself as the protector of white people both at home and abroad.

item.title: Famed Nigerian Author Blames Death of Toddler Son on Negligent Care
item.description: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie is accusing a private hospital in Lagos of administering an overdose of a sedative, prompting an outpouring of complaints by Nigerians about their health care system.
item.dc:creator: Dionne Searcey and Ismail Auwal

media:content.media:credit: Schaun Champion for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie at her home in Maryland in February.

item.title: Golden Globes Highlights: ‘One Battle After Another’ and ‘The Pitt’ Win Big, Chalamet and Seehorn Among First-Time Winners
item.description: “Adolescence” and “One Battle” each won four awards. Wagner Moura, Jessie Buckley, Rhea Seehorn and Timothée Chalamet were among the first-time acting winners.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Krista Schlueter for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The scene at a preview event for the Golden Globes, being held Sunday at the Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills.

item.title: Golden Globes 2026 Takeaways: ‘One Battle After Another' and ‘Adolescence’ Win Big
item.description: The action thriller “One Battle After Another” and the Netflix miniseries “Adolescence” each took home four awards, including the top awards in their respective categories.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Sperling

media:content.media:credit: Kevork Djansezian/CBS Broadcasting, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: The cast of “Adolescence” celebrating after winning the award for best limited series during the 83rd Golden Globes on Sunday.

item.title: Thousands March in New York to Protest ICE Killing and Denounce Trump
item.description: Thousands of protesters, prompted by the fatal shooting of a woman in Minneapolis by a federal immigration agent, gathered near Central Park and marched through Manhattan.
item.dc:creator: Nate Schweber

media:content.media:credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators blocked traffic near Trump Tower during a “No Kings” protest in Manhattan on Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Las amenazas de Trump y el ataque a Venezuela dejan a México en un dilema
item.description: La presidenta Claudia Sheinbaum ha intentado rechazar la intervención militar estadounidense en Venezuela y al mismo tiempo evitar un lenguaje que pudiera provocar al presidente estadounidense.
item.dc:creator: Paulina Villegas and James Wagner

media:content.media:credit: Luis Antonio Rojas para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: La presidenta de México, Claudia Sheinbaum, ha intentado enhebrar una angosta aguja diplomática tras la incursión estadounidense en Venezuela.

item.title: Mass Protests in Iran and Trump’s Threats
item.description: A question now hangs over the country: Is Iran the next target of an emboldened U.S. president?
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

item.title: Jirdes Winther Baxter, 101, Dies; Last Survivor of Epidemic in Alaska
item.description: An outbreak of diphtheria inspired a celebrated sled dog relay of nearly 700 miles to deliver lifesaving serum to the remote town of Nome.
item.dc:creator: Jeré Longman

item.title: 5 rutinas sencillas si quieres comenzar a hacer ejercicio
item.description: Encontrar cómo empezar un nuevo hábito de ejercicio a veces puede ser abrumador. Aquí te damos algunas sugerencias que pueden facilitar tu camino.
item.dc:creator: Erik Vance

media:content.media:credit: Ryan Frigillana para The New York Times
